World Nuclear Newshttps://www.world-nuclear-news.org/?rss=feedWorld Nuclear News recent storiesen-GB 5bfa3ef1-3d47-4214-ba7c-676822e56516 CNEA and Nucleoeléctrica sign CAREM SMR agreementThe National Atomic Energy Commission and Nucleoeléctrica Argentina have signed a framework agreement for technical assistance for the country's CAREM small modular reactor project. Mon, 30 Oct 2023 16:04:20 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Estonia-nuclear-preparations-well-organised,-IAEA?feed=feed 72be9154-e468-4ceb-9b16-2ae9a90a8f35 Cameco announces supply contract at Beijing uranium forumThe supply agreement with China Nuclear International Corporation was finalised earlier this year, Cameco said. The 2023国际天然铀产业发展论坛还介绍了中国国内铀事业的最新进展。; Mon, 30 Oct 2023 15:02:59 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Cameco-announces-supply-contract-at-Beijing-uraniu?feed=feed c0e9cbc0-d230-4bb0-98c6-740dbb47a80e Zoning permit issued for new nuclear at DukovanyThe application for a zoning decision for up to two new nuclear power units at Dukovany in the Czech Republic was submitted in 2021 and ČEZ says the approval by the Ministry of Industry and Trade is a "key milestone". Mon, 30 Oct 2023 14:06:48 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Zoning-permit-issued-for-new-Dukovany-nuclear-unit?feed=feed 5b1731bc-7434-411e-a318-7620c280a9c6 Poland's Pomerania backs proposed nuclear plant locationThe decision by the regional authorities to determine the territorial scope - on both land and sea - of Poland's first nuclear power plant in the Lubiatowo-Kopalino site in the Choczewo municipality in Pomerania意味着 Polskie Elektrownie Jądrowe 已获得使用该区域进行筹备工作的权利。; Fri, 27 Oct 2023 09:47:37 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Poland-s-Pomerania-backs-proposed-nuclear-plant-lo?feed=feed 849e3370-d6b3-4a84-97e6-0c881ca6f961 Satu Katajala becomes WANO regional centre directorThe World Association of Nuclear Operators has appointed Satu Katajala as its next Paris Centre Director in what it describes as a "significant milestone in support of diversity in the nuclear industry". Fri, 27 Oct 2023 15:02:27 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Satu-Katajala-becomes WANO-regional-centre-directo?feed=feed 55ff6cff-0284-4a2c-977a-655c3ace70dfRepair work under way at Krško nuclear power plantThe Krško nuclear power plant was shut down in early October after the discovery of a leak in the primary circuit connection system pipeline. Operator Nuklearna elektrarna Krško says that following further investigation and analysis, a decision has been taken to replace the complete pipeline segment from the reactor vessel to the first valve. Fri, 27 Oct 2023 13:52:00 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Repair-work-under-way-at-Krsko-nuclear-power-plant?feed=feed ec12433b-68f1-4efe-b85e-b39a35f2d3d2 Podcast: World Nuclear Symposium 2023 special report

核燃料报告、融资、招聘、工厂寿命优化和净零核发射都是在伦敦举行的行业全球聚会上举行的高级别小组讨论的总结。

; Sun, 01 Oct 2023 08:46:58 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Podcast-World-Nuclear-Symposium-2023-special-repor?feed=feed 72cfa679-2537-419c-a1a0-7d8bd3cce60dEPRI, NEA in WISARD waste integration collaborationThe upcoming Joint Project on Waste Integration for Small and Advanced Reactor Designs - or WISARD - will focus on exploring how front-end and design phase decisions impact back-end strategies to support sustainable future nuclear systems. Fri, 27 Oct 2023 14:19:34 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/EPRI,-NEA-in-WISARD-waste-integration-collaboratio?feed=feed 4f7f8bf9-35df-428c-98cc-73da1f38a62f CNSC renews licences for Cameco uranium operationsThe renewed licences authorise the company to continue to operate the Key Lake, McArthur River and Rabbit Lake sites. Rabbit Lake's renewed licence is valid until October 2038, and those for Key Lake and McArthur River until October 2043. Thu, 26 Oct 2023 14:33:03 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/CNSC-renews-licences-for-Cameco-uranium-operations?feed=feed 42682e89-5ce5-4944-a128-869d428c7a78 Atucha 1 extension: Environmental impact study submittedNucleoeléctrica Argentina has delivered the environmental impact study for the Atucha I extension project which aims to add a further 20 years to the unit's operating life.
